content: /=A familiar varl steps onto the docks. In your mind you recall a much younger version tramping the halls of Grofheim, abundant in purpose.=/
/=A host of giants depart in his wake. You recognize a few, others are strangers to you.=/
[hakon] And glad for it.
[hakon] Guess I'm off to find Mogr. See you in the morning, scrivener.
/=Hakon motions to the other ships in the bay, sails still fluttering. Golden wolf head emblazoned on red. The king of men, or someone on his behalf.=/
[hakon] Must there?
[hakon] The king's whelp.
[hakon vognir] It's a miserable waste of time.
[hakon] What he's trying to say is the prince is a delight to behold.
[narrator] I have the distinct feeling I've finished my business in Strand and was heading there myself. We should caravan.
[narrator] I'll be along.
[narrator] Then you're going to Grofheim?
[narrator] Vognir.
[narrator vognir] Comes with being old. And, if there is Vognir there must be Hakon.
[narrator vognir] Jorundr demands it. I'll take that over lingering to death in Grofheim. Speaking of, I had no sense that you were so far from home.
{skip} mark1=hakon mark3=vognir mark4=narrator

/=The young prince of men ambles from his ship. He brushes off his tunic, scanning the beach with low eyelids. Ludin looks for all the world the sort of boy who grew up pulling the legs from spiders. The long road back to Grofheim should be more interesting than most years, you think.=/
[vognir] Gods, Ubin, you're looking ancient!
[vognir hakon] Where is Mogr? Hakon, have him find a place to put up the warriors. I'm heading up to meet the governor.
[vognir] Just returned from Arberrang, in fact.
[vognir] Still bleeding tributes from the poor and stupid, old yox? At what age do you lose a sense of shame?
[vognir] The king's son, Ludin. Don't you know, scrivener? We visit his capital, he visits ours. It's how you make alliances these days.
[vognir] We should. Give it a day. In better circumstances I'd drink a week away but, ah... let's just be done. Find me tomorrow at the gates.
[vognir] Yes, Hakon has it. I'd almost forgotten. It's a good thing you're around, Hakon.
